thread.title: Valeant nears deal for 'female Viagra' maker Sprout Pharmaceuticals: WSJ
thread.title_full: Valeant nears deal for 'female Viagra' maker Sprout Pharmaceuticals: WSJ

title: Valeant nears deal for 'female Viagra' maker Sprout Pharmaceuticals: WSJ
text:
Thomson Reuters Company logo of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc is seen at its headquarters in Laval 
(Reuters) - Canada's Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc is nearing a deal to pay $1 billion for Sprout Pharmaceuticals, the company that just won approval to sell the first drug that aims to boost a woman's libido, the Wall Street Journal reported. 
Valeant would pay all cash, one $500 million installment upfront and one next year, for Sprout Pharmaceuticals and its pink libido pills that will be sold under the brand name Addyi, the Journal reported, citing a person familiar with the matter. 
Reuters could not immediately reach Valeant or Sprout for comment outside regular business hours. 
(Reporting by Supriya Kurane in Bengaluru; Editing by Anupama Dwivedi) Read the original article on Reuters . Copyright 2015. Follow Reuters on Twitter . More from Reuters:
